name: infoEnergy
body:
### Welcome to the Information-Energy Nexus
We are a working group at [the University of California, Berkeley](http://www.berkeley.edu) that focuses on the transformative role of information technology on modern energy systems.  infoEnergy shares knowledge and builds tools together, and is mostly made up of researchers and students who are working on our 'own' projects. We are currently partnered with [Cleanweb Berkeley](http://berkeley.cleanweb.co) and the [Berkeley Rural Energy Group](http://breg.berkeley.edu) to extend our reach.

```
We create and curate open-source code :)

The general repository is seeded with a 
file that provides easy interface with 
the CAISO OASIS portal for downloading 
CA electricity market data.  

More to come...
```
Go to the repositories at [github.com/infoenergy](http://github.com/infoenergy) and join the effort.

## Schedule
We meet every other week at the [D-Lab](http://dlab.berkeley.edu) convening room in Barrows Hall room 356 (on the western end of the third floor) at UC Berkeley.

We will try to enable remote participation via a Google Hangout but can't guarantee that will be a smooth process at first.  More info on this soon.

### Next Meeting
**February 14, 2014 from Noon-1 PM**

Agenda
- Discuss currently known / available resources for open energy data and analysis.
- Develop a plan for the semester.  What are the core activities we can do as a working group to add value?
- Other topics welcome.

**"Homework" for Next Meeting**

Please contribute to the two shared google docs:

[A document to aggregate what we know about available code and data](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=0AlEgjnBoKZKqdFdFZTdlZ3pYbXZsWVRET3dYUkR6OVE&usp=sharing)

[Another document for a crowd-sourced list of research groups and projects that are active in the info-energy space](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=0AlEgjnBoKZKqdGd5ajBmMERfTzdzcDF3czdLX0tnWUE#gid=0)

## Connect
[Join the google group to stay up-to-date.](https://groups.google.com/d/forum/infoenergy)

## Partners

### Cleanweb Berkeley
Working with [Cleanweb](http://berkeley.cleanweb.co) we contribute to developing ventures and startups that can take information technology ideas to scale in the private and public sectors.  

### Berkeley Rural Energy Group
[BREG](http://breg.berkeley.edu) is an important partner for infoEnergy's work in the off-grid space, providing a forum for engaging practitioners and academics who are working on energy issues in the developing world.  

## Archive
This was the flyer from the first meeting:
